description: From Middle English cubite, from  Latin cubitum (“elbow, cubit”). Doublet of cubitus.

entries.meaning: The distance from the elbow to the tip of the middle finger used as an informal unit of length.
examples: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

entries.meaning: (historical) Any of various units of length approximating this distance, usually around 35–60 cm.
(anatomy, archaic) Synonym of ulna, the bone of the human forearm.
